events.title: Trump University launches
events.description: Donald Trump founds Trump University, offering real estate and entrepreneurship seminars. Critics later claim it operates like a for-profit scheme. It becomes a legal flashpoint in subsequent lawsuits.

events.title: Trump International Hotel & Tower Las Vegas agreement with Phil Ruffin
events.description: Trump partners 50/50 with casino owner Phil Ruffin to build a gold-glass condo-hotel just off the Las Vegas Strip. Financing arranged through pre-sales and bank loans; groundbreaking soon follows.

events.title: Trump purchases Palm Beach mansion Maison de L'Amitié
events.description: Donald Trump buys a 6-acre oceanfront estate in Palm Beach, Florida for $41.35 million at a bankruptcy auction. He outbids Jeffrey Epstein for the property, which he later renovates with gold fixtures and lists for $125 million in 2006.

events.title: Trump secures $640 million Deutsche Bank loan for Chicago Tower
events.description: Deutsche Bank's commercial real estate unit provides Trump with a $640 million construction loan to build Trump International Hotel & Tower in Chicago. Trump personally guarantees $40 million of this debt. This marked one of the few major banks willing to lend to Trump after his earlier financial troubles.

events.title: Trump and Bayrock Group explore Moscow tower project
events.description: Donald Trump signs a one-year exclusive agreement with Bayrock Group, led by Tevfik Arif and Felix Sater, to explore developing a Trump Tower in Moscow. Bayrock scouts potential sites, including a former pencil factory, and seeks Russian investors. This marks Trump's first serious attempt at an overseas development since the 1990s.

entity-001.name: Donald J. Trump
entity-001.description: Real estate developer, businessman, and television personality. In 2005, launched Trump University and partnered with Phil Ruffin on the Las Vegas Trump International Hotel & Tower project, continuing to leverage his brand for new ventures.

entity-038.name: Phil Ruffin
entity-038.description: Casino owner and businessman who partnered with Trump on a 50/50 basis to develop the Trump International Hotel & Tower in Las Vegas in 2005.

Bayrock Group.name: Bayrock Group
Bayrock Group.description: Real estate development and investment company led by Tevfik Arif with executive Felix Sater that partnered with Trump on multiple projects from 2005-2008, including the Trump SoHo in New York.
Bayrock Group.notes: Bayrock's executive Felix Sater was a convicted felon (stock fraud) who had Russian and Soviet connections.

Deutsche Bank.name: Deutsche Bank
Deutsche Bank.description: Global banking and financial services company. By mid-2000s, it was the only major bank willing to lend Trump significant money after his earlier defaults with other financial institutions.

Trump University students.name: Trump University students
Trump University students.description: Individuals who paid for real estate and entrepreneurship seminars from Trump University between 2005-2010. Many later claimed they were misled, resulting in multiple lawsuits.

relationships.description: Trump partnered with Phil Ruffin on a 50/50 basis to develop the Trump International Hotel & Tower in Las Vegas.
Deutsche Bank's commercial real estate unit provided Trump with a $640 million construction loan for Trump International Hotel & Tower in Chicago, with Trump personally guaranteeing $40 million.
Trump partnered with Bayrock Group to explore developing a Trump Tower in Moscow and later collaborated on projects in New York, Florida, and Arizona.

transactions.description: Trump purchases the Maison de L'Amitié estate in Palm Beach, Florida at a bankruptcy auction, outbidding Jeffrey Epstein.
transactions.notes: This property would later be sold to Russian billionaire Dmitry Rybolovlev in 2008 for $95 million, more than doubling Trump's investment.

transactions.description: Deutsche Bank provides Trump with a $640 million construction loan for Trump International Hotel & Tower in Chicago.
transactions.notes: Trump personally guaranteed $40 million of this loan. The loan was syndicated, with Deutsche Bank holding about $334 million and other institutions participating.

transactions.description: Estimated revenue from Trump University through fees paid by students for real estate and entrepreneurship seminars.
transactions.notes: Trump University faced legal challenges and complaints of deceptive practices. In 2005, NY authorities warned Trump about using the term 'University' without a license.

transactions.description: Trump's estimated investment in the Trump International Hotel & Tower Las Vegas project, which he developed as a 50/50 partnership with Phil Ruffin.
transactions.notes: The total development cost was estimated at $140 million, with Trump's half being approximately $70 million.

transactions.description: Trump's estimated investment in the exploratory phase of a potential Trump Tower Moscow project with Bayrock Group.
transactions.purpose: Market entry research and initial planning
transactions.russianConnectionType: Project was explicitly targeting development in Moscow with Russian financing
transactions.notes: While no Moscow tower was realized during this period, the efforts demonstrate Trump's interest in expanding into Russia. Bayrock's Felix Sater reportedly had connections to Russian officials and financiers.
